comment: I can't stress enough how good of a professor Prof. Riemann is. He genuinely cares about each of his students and gives great lectures. He has one group project that will take all semester, but it is a gratifying assignment. 10/10 would recommend, take him!

Take him! You will never be bored during classes, I guarantee. He learns everyone's name and is so caring, but also very professional and interesting. Quizzes and discussion posts every week, 3-4 exams, and a group project.

Professor Riemann was a gem. Truly a great teacher. He learned EVERYONE'S names by the first exam. So insightful and encouraged interaction with your group members. Tests are based on his quizzes, so practice those AT LEAST 5 times EACH if you want an A. Group project was pretty easy. So sad that he is moving to Maine! I hope he continues teaching.

Hands-down, the best professor ever had in my entire life. Class is based on 3 exams (lowest replaced with your quiz grade - super easy (you can get them done beginning of semester), discussions every week, a group project (can't choose partners), final. lecture heavy but interesting, only tests on material in lecture + videos (in class), examquiz
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Honestly the best professor I have taken at KSU. His classes are amazing to attend for real life applications and are quite engaging. Professor Riemann is incredibly funny and wants to know his students and genuinely cares for them. One massive interview project, 3 tests, discussion posts, and optional quizzes that replace your lowest test grade.
Professor Riemann is simply the best. I truly enjoyed taking his course and learned so much. I 100% recommend taking him!

This class is a joke and he makes it nearly impossible to do well on the tests. All weve talked about is Tesla and the midterm was over stuff we NEVER covered. He gives you no help and expects the absolute most out of you. If you skip any discussions/classes, your grade will be sorry. Hes a nice prof, but the class is way too hard for no reason.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Makes you buy a Wall Street Journal subscription and everything is very persuasive and one way thinking. Switched classes very quickly.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: BEST CLASS I HAVE EVER TAKEN!! HE cares for you and helps you out. The discussion posts are easy, the exams arent hard just take the practice quizzes, and the group project is a joke. Do the optional quizzes for a free 100 as a test grade. And show up to class. I want to take him again in the future!!!!!

THE best prof I've taken at KSU thus far. His lectures are interesting and actually make you want to show up for class. It's obvious Riemann truly cares about each and every one of his students. There are weekly discussion boards, 3 tests, and optional quizzes that replace your lowest test grade. There is a also semester long group project.

One thing I would said about this class is dont take if if you dont have time. Because it is required that you go to 18 events and it will really ruined your grade if you not. This class take too much time.

Nice guy, wouldnt take this class if you dont have time to go to events outside of class. Project requires each group to attend 18 events for full credit. Participation in class will affect your grade. Tests are straight forward. Easy optional quizzes to replace low test grade. Just know- this class requires A LOT OF TIME OUTSIDE OF CLASS. A lot.

If u have a life outside of this class dont take it. Semester long group project that requires you to attend a minimum 12 events. Constants discussion boards and if u miss class he will kill you on your 25% attendance grade. Tough grader but is a pretty nice guy. Just too much work outside of class.

Riemann is such a good dude, and he really makes this course as easy as it can possibly be. The most difficult part is the group project and coordinating everything. Just listen to how he tells you to prepare for the tests and dont be a crappy team member in your group project and you will be fine. Best, most caring professor Ive ever taken!!

Take his class. This is the first class I have taken that makes me feel like I learned something useful for my life. Yes, he makes you work for a good grade, but he makes it easily attainable. Do the online quizzes and show up for class and you'll ace the tests. You can tell he wants his students to succeed - in the classroom and in life.

Class attendance is required, but the discussions are fantastic. He makes class very interesting and I actually looked forward to going to his class. Two online discussion posts a week (due before class), a mid-term and final exam. One of the best professors I have ever had. TAKE HIM. You will not regret it :)

Very passionate about the many businesses that are succeeding in today's world. This class will teach you about what gives a company an advantage over another. Overall, really great and smart professor. Discussion posts due before every class with a midterm and final. I really wish the class was a little more visual however.

He is definitely passionate. The lectures aren't as exciting as people say. It's a powerpoint and him constantly talking about how great Tesla is. He's incredibly nice and tries to get to know everyone. He does read your discussions and tries to tie those into the lectures. Group project is almost another class b/c how much outside work there is.

Professor Riemann is the best professor I have ever had. He honestly cares about his students' success and invests his whole self into us. The class is not very demanding, but it is somewhat time consuming considering there is a semester long group project. The group project is FUN and you learn so much more than just about Management. TAKE HIM!

Professor Riemann is by far one of my favorite professors here at KSU. He knows what he is teaching, his lectures are very engaging and he wants to get to know you and prepare you for the corporate world. He does not accept late work and there is a group project that takes the whole semester to do. Also the quizzes are on quizlet.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Riemann is one of the best teachers at KSU. He is very enthusiastic about his class. Grading 25% first half participation, 25% second half participation, 25% midterm, 25% final. The midterm and Final is all essay. To do well on discussion grade POST EARLY AND REPLY to other peoples post. In class make sure you speak up or ask questions.

Very enthusiastic and engaging professor that gets along well with everyone. Very interesting and entertaining lectures. He engages the class in a lot of discussions, which make it more fun. 25% of the grade is class participation, 25% is online discussion board, and 50% is made of 2 tests that are essay format in class. Not hard if you participate
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Literally the BEST professor at KSU. You will learn so many cool and interesting things, and always leave class feeling inspired. Discussion board posts are required before every class. It sounds like a lot, but it's really not that bad. Please take him, you won't regret it! I would take his class every semester if I could.

Professor Riemann has been one of my favorite professors throughout college. The class is centered around class discussions. There are discussion board posts due every class. Most require research and you must comment on three other classmates posts and respond to any that post on your own. Participation is huge. Only two tests: midterm and final

There are discussion post due before EVERY class. He gives full credit if you post the discussion early, respond to each person that responds to your discussion, & detailed response. Coming late deduct points from your participation grade. 2 exams all essay format, no powerpoint/notes posted online, come to class, and actively participate.

Riemann helps you escape the classroom and look at what is happening in the real world. He based all lectures on discussion board posts he DOES read. He makes it interactive and helps you understand the companies you talk about on a deeper level. Come to class because he does want to see your face. 2 tests short answer. Txtbook for cases. TAKE HIM

Great Professor! Discussion based class, in class and on d2l. Lectures/discussions in class are fun exciting. He's probably the best professor in Coles. Like for real! 2 Tests (midterm and final) Tests are essays but he gives you the essays 2 weeks before them and gives you an index card to help you on the tests.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Would take again

comment: Great management professor. Doing the bare minimum will likely result in a B-C. DISCUSSION POST EVERY CLASS!! These are the primary focus of the class and if you can write a couple paragraphs a week you will be fine. In class participation is also a big part of the grade so you probably should not skip.
Would take again.

By far one of the best professors at KSU! Professor Riemann truly cares about each of his students. His class lectures are amazing and made me excited to attend class. He has 3 exams and replaces your lowest exam score with your quiz average (easy 100).  Semester long group project. Take his class if you have the opportunity!! Highly recommend!!

He is a very passionate, exciting, and knowledgeable professor. Hands down, the best professor I have had the pleasure of taking. If you somehow get into his class you won't regret it. Be prepared to speak, but he is warm, and inviting in his lectures. Take him!
He was very passionate. Kept you awake easily in each lecture. One of the best professors I've ever had.
Best teacher at Kennesaw. He really cares about his students. If you don't make an A you aren't trying at all. He puts practice questions on D2L that are very similar to test questions.
Great professor! I would take him again! Wants you to pay attention as he has a lot of experience in the area of management - it's important! Definitely made me more engaged in the subject.
Loved Riemann! Great attitude and personality, actually made me want to go to class because of how enthusiastic he is. Easy group project all semester long, weekly discussions, and 3 Tests. No final.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: One of the best prof at KSU. His test are fairly easy because they are the same questions from the online quizzes. Group project was unusual but easy. Make sure you get a good group because your grade will depend on the peer reviews. Had to go to a bunch of events on campus or outside to do the project. There is a quiz every week. Easy A.
3 tests (all multiple choice), a fairly easy project, and participation make your grade. Just come to class and put in some work and there is no reason you can't get at least a B. Take Him!

DO NOT TAKE HIM.... HE HARDEST TEST I HAVE STUIDED FOR. He expects us to memorize 5 chapters for notes for this 50 question test (IN CLASS). He has great lectures, but I didn't learn nothing besides memorizing notes .  You loose points if your whole doesnt show up, if you have  nonmembers like me, you'll loose points on you final grade. NO extra C
He's test are hard, they covers nothing he is going to put on the test. Rather take a different teacher
Best professor at Kennesaw State. Take him

Awesome class. Group project is different than most--you attend events with your group over the course of the semester and present material you felt you learned the most from. Also he brought donut holes to class twice!

Dr. Riemann is a good teacher, but the only problem is that he tries to cram six chapters into each test, and since the chapters are 20 pages each, it will be a long night if you wait to study for each test. He also gives a group project, he selects your group members, and the project counts 20% of your grade. The paper is only 4-5 pages.

His lectures can be a bit boring, but he knows his stuff. Anything you hear positive about this guy is totally true. It's a tough class, but he makes it feel less painful than it would be otherwise. Even though between his classes he has hundreds of students, he takes the time to learn everyone's name, and he made everyone feel personally important

He's an awesome guy with a lot of experience. He's understanding and will know you by name by the end of the semester. He likes to connect on a personal level and really cares about his teaching. Would definitely recommend.

He teaches as a hobby, so he brings a good bit of enthusiasm to class.  The big Capsim competition (as mentioned before) is graded based on standing in the competition at the end.  He basically finishes the textbook and test the 1st half of the semester, then the remainder is devoted to capsim and case presentations.

Professor Riemann is an outstanding professor. He truly appears to love what he is doing and his energy is contagious. You will learn a lot about management and will be entertained. Yes, as early post said, easy on the eyes (fringe benefit). Caring, considerate, professional, and obviously a VERY bright individual. Highly recommend him.

Very interesting and helpful professor. There is a lot of out-of-class work and he really tries to get you to understand each concept and to think things through. Be careful with Capsim. If you get in a bad team and don't know what you're doing, you're screwed. Not an easy class at all, but definitely a good teacher.

Prof. Riemann is just outstanding! He has well planned and interesting lectures that are also informative. He calls teaching his "hobby" and he truly enjoys what he does. slightly unorthodox in his grading of the Capsim; only the winning team gets full credit, but he gives you all you need to succeed! Outstanding Professor!

Prof. Riemann is truly one of the most caring, kind and well-spoken teachers I've ever had. Going to his lectures were such a pleasure (very easy on the eyes, as well). We covered the textbook the first half of semester and did CapSim the remaining half, meeting with him only once per week. Lots of work, but very completion-oriented grading.

Riemann is the man.  He is a great speaker, which makes the material sound way more interesting than it actually is.  You have to take this crap, so I would definitely reccommend him.  He has quality real-world experience to share.  Definitely the best management class I have ever taken, although that's not saying much.

Professor Riemann is great and he truly cares about his students. He's very enthusiastic about the material and his discussions are engaging. MGT 4199 isn't the best course but he makes it as good as it can be. I would highly recommend taking him.

Riemann is an awesome guy. He has a quirky personality, is playfully sarcastic and always has a big smile on his face. class discussions are really interesting. He gives you a study guide for each exam with everything you need to know, and he teaches the material well enough to grasp the concepts with out having to tediously study outside of class
